page.title: 18School in June
page.content:
Schule in June
It's June wi'a splairge o'colour In glen an'on hill An'it's me wad be lyin'up yonner But then- there's the schule.
Robert Bain. As I look around the classroom on a sun-filled June morning I cannot help but recall this verse of a 'weel kent' Scots poem.Each young face echoes the sentiment and one can forgive them in the prevailing circumstances. To children who live in such an open environment,freedom of the countryside is a way of life.They know the secret places,the sercret ways,the oft played games and pastimes. For some,the confines of the school on such a morning must be hard to endure when life itself is waiting outside.
